title: Prompt Engineering Half-Life
context: As LLMs became mainstream, 'prompt engineering' emerged as a hot skill. Job postings appeared. Courses launched. People built careers around crafting the perfect prompt. But models improve with every release — techniques that worked on GPT-3.5 are unnecessary on GPT-4, and irrelevant on GPT-5. The skill has a half-life measured in months, not years. The better the models get, the less prompt engineering matters.
hypothesis: Prompt engineering is a valuable, durable career skill worth investing in.

chain.root: Invest heavily in prompt engineering as a core skill

effects.label: Techniques become obsolete with each model generation
effects.impact: Half-life of specific prompt techniques: 6-12 months

children.label: Chain-of-thought prompting built into newer models by default
Few-shot examples become unnecessary as models improve
Prompt 'hacks' patched in subsequent model versions

effects.label: Models converge toward natural language understanding
effects.impact: Simple instructions increasingly match complex prompts

children.label: The gap between expert and novice prompts narrows with each generation
Domain expertise becomes more valuable than prompt syntax

effects.label: Prompt engineering roles get absorbed into existing jobs

children.label: Every knowledge worker becomes a 'prompt engineer' by default
The skill commoditizes — like knowing how to use a search engine
People who invested in prompt-only skills find them insufficient

effects.label: Agentic AI reduces prompting to configuration
effects.impact: Agents handle multi-step reasoning without manual prompt chains

children.label: Tool use and function calling replace elaborate prompt structures
System-level orchestration matters more than individual prompts

impact.metric: Value of domain expertise vs prompt skill

dontIf: You're building a career exclusively around prompt engineering without domain expertise
You're investing in prompt engineering courses that teach model-specific techniques
ifYouMust: Focus on understanding model capabilities and limitations, not specific syntax tricks
Pair prompt skills with deep domain expertise — the combination is durable
Learn system design for AI applications, not just individual prompts
Stay current — what works today will change in 6 months

alternatives.name: AI application architecture
alternatives.note: Designing systems that use AI effectively — durable regardless of model changes

alternatives.name: Domain expertise + AI literacy
alternatives.note: Knowing your field deeply and understanding how to leverage AI within it

alternatives.name: Evaluation and testing
alternatives.note: Knowing how to measure AI output quality — this skill grows more valuable as AI scales

sources.title: Ethan Mollick: Prompt Engineering is Dead, Long Live Prompt Engineering
sources.note: Analysis of how model improvements are making elaborate prompting techniques unnecessary

sources.title: OpenAI: GPT-4 Technical Report
sources.note: Each model generation reduces the need for prompt engineering workarounds

sources.title: Indeed: Prompt Engineer Job Posting Trends
sources.note: Prompt engineer job postings peaked in 2023 and have been declining as the role gets absorbed

sources.title: Anthropic: Building Effective Agents
sources.note: Agentic patterns shift value from individual prompts to system-level orchestration

falsifiability: Prompt engineering techniques from 2023 remain equally effective on models released in 2026 without modification
Standalone prompt engineer roles grow as a percentage of AI job postings through 2027
Expert-crafted prompts consistently outperform simple natural language instructions by 2x+ on latest models

seo.description: Prompt engineering techniques have a 6-12 month half-life. Each model generation makes elaborate prompting less necessary. Domain expertise outlasts prompt syntax every time.
keywords: prompt engineering half-life second order effects
